resource.name: Business Licenses
resource.description: Registered businesses in the City of Berkeley with business license records
columns_description: Name of Business

A new Business License application must reflect an accurate classification of the business activity, and your annual BLT renewal payment is based on the corresponding rate (based on gross receipts, rents, or other business-specific income). Current list of classifications and tax rates is listed here: http://www.ci.berkeley.ca.us/Finance/Home/Business_Licenses__Classifications___Tax_Rates.aspx.

The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) is the standard used by Federal statistical agencies in classifying business establishments for the purpose of collecting, analyzing, and publishing statistical data related to the U.S. business economy.
Further information can be found at the US Census Bureau http://www.census.gov/eos/www/naics/.
Business Contact Address Line 2
Detailed description of type of work performed
Business Physical Street Address of Business in Berkeley (if 0 Various then business is located elsewhere but operates in Berkeley without a physical location, i.e. contractor, etc).
APN is the acronym for “Assessor’s Parcel Number”. Note, “Z”s in this field represent a business that is not physically located in the City of Berkeley.

resource.name: City of Berkeley Employee Salaries - 2011
resource.description: All salaries as reported on Transparent California, http://transparentcalifornia.com/, for 2011
columns_description: The “Overtime pay” column includes overtime compensation as the reporting agency classifies it.
The "Other pay" category includes the compensation in the numerous other pay categories some public employees receive.

"Total benefits" only includes benefits directly received by the employee: medical insurance (health, dental, and vision) and employer-paid retirement contributions. The total cost of the employee will be higher than the values reported here as there are associated costs (such as workman's comp, state unemployment insurance, medicare/SS costs, etc) that we do not report as employee compensation.
The "Total pay & benefits" column underreports the total compensation of government employees whose government employer did not provided complete salary or benefit information.

resource.name: PavementMoratorium
resource.description: GIS dataset to locate moratoriums issued on newly paved streets that preclude, or greatly restrict, trench cuts or other right-of-way activity.

resource.name: BESO Time of Sale Property Status
resource.description: This list contains the compliance status of properties subject to the BESO time of sale requirement. If your building is not listed then it is required to comply with BESO at time of sale. If the status for your property is incorrect, email BESO@CityofBerkeley.info. For more information about the time of sale requirement please visit: www.cityofberkeley.info/besosale/
columns_description: Buildings are grouped by the following property types: House 1-4 Units, Multifamily 5+ Units, Commercial, Mixed Use, Industrial, and Other
Date the energy assessment is due if it has been deferred.
This is the simplified status for the time of sale requirement.
If the status description is Deferred to Buyer (Form C) or Deferred (Form D) than an assessment is required to be submitted by the energy report due date.

domain_metadata.value: Energy use in our homes and commercial buildings is the second leading contributor of greenhouse gases in the City of Berkeley making up almost 40% of our overall greenhouse gas emissions, according to 2016 available data.  BESO requires building owners and homeowners to complete and publicly report comprehensive energy assessments to uncover energy saving opportunities. The assessments are conducted by registered energy assessors who provide tailored recommendations on how to save energy and link building owners to incentive programs for energy efficiency upgrades. Energy efficiency improvements are voluntary and encouraged. BESO is required prior to sale of a house or whole building under 25,000 square feet. This dataset contains the status of properties compliant or non-compliant with the BESO time of sale requirement. Properties are listed once an application has been submitted. Building owners can look-up and verify their building’s status on the open data portal for the BESO requirement.

resource.name: Taxable Square Footage
resource.description:
This dataset of taxable square footage per property is used to calculate special assessments approved by Berkeley voters in ballot measures.  

Alameda County’s property tax bills include taxes, fixed charges, and special assessments from many agencies, including the City of Berkeley. Most voter-approved City of Berkeley special assessments and taxes are based on taxable square footage, not assessed value.
columns_description: Street Fraction
Street Number
Street Direction
Street Name
Assessor Parcel Number
Unit
Taxable Square Footage

converted at 3,412 Btus per kWh

domain_metadata.value: All energy metered by PG&E. Does not include electrical power delivered to LBL through their own substation.  Includes natural gas for cogenerator on UCB campus.  Electrical generation from the cogenerator is fed directly into the grid. PG&E cannot generate data for 1993 - 1998 or for 2001-2004.  Includes wholesale (direct access and non-core gas) power as well.  Conversion to million Btu (MMBtu) of energy delivered to the site = (kWh *3412.3)/1,000,000 and (therms*100,000)/1,000,000.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Police Beats' (3ini-iehf) the point in column 'location' is located. This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Council Districts_from_hg3u_n7v4' (fhmw-rucx) the point in column 'location' is located. This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

columns_description: Total number of PCR lab tests resulted by the date the test was resulted as reported in CalREDIE among Berkeley residents. The last line of the dataset reflects lab results that are missing both the date the test was resulted and the specimen collection date in CalREDIE.
Dates reflect the date the test was resulted as reported in CalREDIE, or the specimen collection date as reported in CalREDIE, if the date the test was resulted is missing.

Cumulative number of PCR lab tests resulted by the date the test was resulted as reported in CalREDIE among Berkeley residents. The last line of the dataset reflects lab results that are missing both the date the test was resulted and the specimen collection date in CalREDIE.

This dataset was provided to the Berkeley City Auditor for the Fiscal Year 2020 report entitled:  Data Analysis of the City of Berkeley's Police Response (5/11/21).  The data provided herein include calls for service for the years 2015-2019.  For a definition of the columns, please refer to the attached document entitled:  Auditor's Report (5-11-21) Tabular Data Definitions (Updated May 27, 2021).pdf. 

*  Updated on May 27, 2021.  The initial dataset uploaded was a slightly different version.  This May 27 update is the version used for the analysis.

resource.name: City of Berkeley: Operating Budget
resource.description: Operating budget information for fiscal years 2012 through 2015
columns_description: An organizational unit comprised of divisions or programs. It is possible for a department to be comprised of only one division.

A independent fiscal and accounting entity with a self-balancing set of accounts recording cash and/or other resources, together with all related liabilities, obligations, reserves and equities which are segregated for the purpose of carrying on specific activities or attaining certain objectives in accordance with special regulations.
A twelve-month period of time to which the budget applies.   For the City of Berkeley, this period is from July 1 through June 30.

resource.name: Restaurant Inspections
resource.description: This data set contains inspection information for approximately 800 food facilities permitted in the City of Berkeley. These include restaurants, bars, grocery stores, markets and any facility that dispenses food to the public. This information includes name and address of the food facility, identification of any major or minor violations, and date of last inspection. Data is updated once a week.

resource.name: Berkeley PD - Stop Data (October 1, 2020 - Present)
resource.description:
Berkeley PD transitioned to RIPA stop data collection effective October 1, 2020.  Data collected from these stops conforms to requirements set forth in Government Code section 12525.5 that was enacted as a result of AB 953, the Racial and Identity Profiling Act (RIPA) of 2015 (https://oag.ca.gov/ab953).  Berkeley PD will begin reporting RIPA data to the CA DOJ effective January 1, 2021.

For more information about any of the column definitions, please download the document:  One Page Narrative for Stop Data (October 1, 2020).pdf.
columns_name: In field cite and release Offense Codes
Person had Limited or No English Fluency
Is Location a K12 Public School
Is Stop Made in Response to Call for Service
If K12 School Is Stop of a Student

domain_metadata.value: See "One Page Narrative for Stop Data (October 1, 2020).pdf"
